lines.text: your friend is a barbarian.
Tony. You gonna sit here and hear your friend called a barbarian?
Miguel, I forbid you to call this barbarian a barbarian.

[nods]
You're a true friend.

[on assurance that a smuggling job's been completed]
A friend left this, uh, note for you.

[flipping through the money in the envelope]
Our friend didn't have very much to say, did he?
What do you mean by that?
I mean he wasn't very generous, was he?
There are many expenses; you know that as well as I do. Palms to be greased and people paid to turn the other way. It's getting harder every day.
Well, you tell that friend if he can't be a little more communicative, that this is the last trip.
Are you wanted by the police?
if I *presented* myself to them, they would not *reject* me.
I sowed my wild oats a long time ago. Been living off the crop ever since. Not very nutritious.
I'm waiting for someone to touch me with kindness.

I'm no good. I'm all worn out. I've been passed from hand to hand. I've had to submit to things that nice young American boys couldn't conceive of in their wildest nightmares. I've lived among the ruins. Armies have marched over me.

[watching sailors fight a fire]
The American navy is at work.
What do they say?
They don't say anything. They just whistle through their teeth and call for Coca-Colas.
Sometimes you wonder what God had in mind when He invented the male sex.
What a country America is. All the luxuries. Even rebellion.
What a wonderful thing it is to be an American. You believe you can forget everything.
